resource.name: PhpMoAdmin.moadmin.php.Unauthenticated.Remote.Code.Execution
resource.description: This indicates an attack attempt against a remote Code Execution vulnerability in phpMoAdmin. The vulnerability is caused by an error when the vulnerable software handles a malicious HTTP request containing a crafted URI. A remote attacker may be able to exploit this to execute arbitrary code within the context of the application, via a crafted HTTP request

message.content:
Setting the Alert details:

Alert Description: {{vars.incident_source_data.attributes.incidentTitle}}

{%if vars.incident_source_data.attributes.srcIpAddr%}Source IP:{{vars.incident_source_data.attributes.srcIpAddr}}{%endif%}
{%if vars.incident_source_data.attributes.destIpAddr%}Destination IP: {{vars.incident_source_data.attributes.destIpAddr}}{%endif%}

Click Here for the Attack Details on Fortiguard.com

resource.name: {{vars.incident_source_data.attributes.eventName}}-{{vars.incident_source_data.attributes.incidentId}}

steps.name: TASK_Check if server is vulnerable to the Attack

message.content: **TASK:** Compare the received Attack CVE with the list of the Asset Vulnerabilities. 1) Identify the Attack Vulnerability CVE via FortiGuard Right click here => Open in a new TAB 2) Compare the CVE with the below CVE to which the Asset is vulnerable: {{vars.steps.Record_Vulnerabilities.cveId}} 3) if the above CVE matches the one on FortiGuard escalate the alert - Open the alert - Click Escalate Button on the bottom left of the page - Fill Incident Name: Web Server Remote Exploit - Set Severity to High - Set Incident Lead to your username - Fill Escalation Reason: Attack on vulnerable web server

resource.name: Check if server is vulnerable to the Attack
resource.taskdata: Check if the server is vulnerable to the Attack
resource.description: Compare the received Attack CVE with the list of the Asset Vulnerabilities. 1) Identify the Attack Vulnerability CVE via FortiGuard Right click here => Open in a new TAB 2) Compare the CVE with the below CVE to which the Asset is vulnerable: {{vars.steps.Record_Vulnerabilities.cveId}} 3) if the above CVE matches the one on FortiGuard escalate the alert - Open the alert - Click Escalate Button on the bottom left of the page - Fill Incident Name: Web Server Remote Exploit - Set Severity to High - Set Incident Lead to your username - Fill Escalation Reason: Attack on vulnerable web server

resource.approvaldescription: Should I send an email to the attacker ISP ?

params.content: We were object of a remote exploit attack on our assets from your IP {{vars.source_ip}} kindly take the appropriate measures to prevent this in the future.
params.subject: Remote exploit from your Prefix

message.content: Sending a complain message to the Attacker ISP at {{vars.steps.Get_Attacker_IP_Information.data.objects[0].contact.address[0].value}}
Attacker IP Reputation Score from VirusTotal.com: {{vars.result.data.aggregate}}

schema.title: Identify Targeted File
schema.description: Browse the Alert Source Data (Open new window) and identify the file targeted by the attack

resource.content: Targeted File Name is important for the investigation, since it couldn't be provided at the playbook execution time, identify it and add it to the alert
resource.rawCommentData: Targeted File Name is important for the investigation, since **it couldn't be provided** at the playbook execution time, identify it and add it to the alert

routes.name: Update Alert -> Check if server vulnerable to the Attack
Email Notification to ISP -> Send Email to ISP
ISP Contact present -> Email Notification to ISP
routes.label: yes

routes.name: Get Attacker IP Information -> Get Attacker IP Reputation VT
Get Attacker IP Reputation VT -> Find Vulnerability
Create WebServer Asset -> Identify Targeted File
Identify Targeted File -> Targeted File Name not entered
routes.label: Cancel

routes.name: Targeted File Name not entered -> Configuration
